ThingDef.label: crowbar
ThingDef.description: Iconic piece of hardware wielded by your favorite theoretical physicist. Despite it's legendary status it is not very strong, but offers both blunt and sharp damage.

ThingDef.label: stunstick
ThingDef.description: Electric baton used widely by Metropolice officers to pacify insubordinate citizens. It offers some stunning capability.

ThingDef.label: combine machine gun
ThingDef.description: Combine's take on the classic minigun design. This pulse machine gun, while only sporting a single barrel unlike its inspration, still posesses a spinup until it can fire.

ThingDef.label: modified autopistol
ThingDef.description: An ancient pattern blowback-operated self-loading pistol. It lacks stopping power and range, but is quick to fire. This one has been modified in a combine fabricator, adding burst fire to it.

ThingDef.label: combine pulse shotgun
ThingDef.description: A heavy pulse shotgun, firing multiple pellets of energy effectively working in an identical fashion to classic shotguns.

ThingDef.label: MP5
ThingDef.description: A compact, wide-caliber slug-thrower. It's got a very short range, but it packs a punch and handles quite well. Equipped with an underbarrel grenade launcher.

ThingDef.label: M16
ThingDef.description: Standard issue assault rifle used by H.E.C.U forces alongside the MP5. Equipped with an underbarrel grenade launcher.

ThingDef.label: displacer cannon
ThingDef.description: The Displacer Cannon is a portable teleportation weapon developed by Black Mesa before the Black Mesa Incident. This weapon generates a displacement field (or portal) ahead of the user. This slow-moving portal will cause a massive explosion when it hits its target obliterating anything nearby.

ThingDef.label: Tau Cannon
ThingDef.description: A prototype energy-based assault rifle, the Tau Cannon is a weapon developed by scientists at Black Mesa. Its advanced technology allows it to use depleted Uranium-235 as fuel.

ThingDef.label: tau projectile beam
ThingDef.description: A focused, long range tau particle beam.

ThingDef.label: SAW
ThingDef.description: An LMG with high rate of fire. Not very accurate, but given the firepower serves well as a suppressive weapon.

ThingDef.label: Tranquilizer Crossbow
ThingDef.description: A modified crossbow with a scope, firing darts filled with potent trqnauilizer. Can be used to incapacitate targets. One must be careful as darts do still cause damage and potential bleeding.

ThingDef.label: Rocket Launcher
ThingDef.description: A laser-guided, reloadable rocket launcher.

ThingDef.label: RPG
ThingDef.description: A laser-guided, reloadable rocket launcher, in a more modern package.

ThingDef.label: SPAS-12
ThingDef.description: A Black Mesa security team staple, fires tight spread of buckshot towards target.

ThingDef.label: SPAS-12 Tactical
ThingDef.description: SPAS-12 version adopted by the Combine.

ThingDef.label: Compact Shotgun
ThingDef.description: Small, semi-auto, tube-fed shotgun. It's design allows to fire it one handed with ease, but its short length impacts accuracy.

ThingDef.label: Python 357
ThingDef.description: A classic handcannon.

ThingDef.label: Glock 9mm
ThingDef.description: 9mm Glock 17 pistol. A staple of Black Mesa Security Team.

ThingDef.label: USP Match
ThingDef.description: 9mm USP Match pistol. Standard issue for Metropolice officers.

ThingDef.label: MP7
ThingDef.description: MP7 submachine gun, widely used by Metropolice, Overwatch soldiers and Resistance members alike.

ThingDef.label: OICW
ThingDef.description: An experimental rifle used by Overwatch soldiers in the early days. Its bulky but packs a punch.

ThingDef.label: Annabelle
ThingDef.description: A customized over-under TOZ-34 shotgun firing slugs. A holy weapon indeed.

ThingDef.label: rebar crossbow
ThingDef.description: Makeshift crossbow designed to fire superheated rebar. Equipped with a scope for long range engagements.

ThingDef.label: AR2 Pulse Rifle
ThingDef.description: Overwatch Standard Issue Pulse Rifle, used widely by the Overwatch forces all around the world.

ThingDef.label: Hivehand
ThingDef.description: The hivehand, or the hornet gun is an organic weapon used by the alien grunts from Xen. It fires homing "hornets" that give it great accuracy, however the damage output of the weapon is low. It fires a burst of 8 hornets at low rate of fire, and requires a recharge after firing. Since it is a living creature it cannot be manufactured.

ThingDef.label: Shockroach
ThingDef.description: The Shock Roach has all the characteristics of a large insect, with six legs and a tri-segmented body. Unlike the Hive Hand, the bio-weapon employed by Alien Grunts, the Shock Roach can move, react and attack of its own accord, as it is a living creature. It cannot be manufactured.

ThingDef.label: spore launcher
ThingDef.description: An infant Shock Trooper, the Spore Launcher resembles a large lungfish or tadpole, with a smooth rounded skull crowned by spikes, gills along its side and trailing tentacles. The creature can store the mushroom-like spores which dot parts of Black Mesa in its digestive tract, and then launch them forcibly when required to. It seems to have an affectionate nature, often making purring noises.

ThingDef.label: pulse submachine gun
ThingDef.description: More compact version of the Overwatch pulse rifle. Deals less damage than the AR2, but fires slightly faster and is more accurate at shorter ranges.

ThingDef.label: snark nest
ThingDef.description: A "pacified" snark nest. Wielder can reach into the rather disgusting object and pull out a snark to throw. Keep in mind snarks will attack anyone regardless of the faction, but will ignore animals.

ThingDef.label: heavy pulse cannon turret
ThingDef.description: Tripod-mounted pulse cannon salvaged from a combine gunship. Fires faster and in longer bursts than the mini-turret

ThingDef.label: pulse cannon
ThingDef.description: Pulse cannon salvaged from a combine gunship.
